required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Add-on Effectiveness of EA or TENS in Early Postpartum Breast Engorgement
clinical_study.official_title: Comparing the add-on Effectiveness of Electro-acupuncture or Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation in Early Postpartum Breast Engorgement: A Pilot Randomized Pragmatic Trial

brief_summary.textblock: A total of 36 volunteers of postpartum women within 7 days with significant breast engorgement, will be recruited in China Medical University Hospital, Taichung, Taiwan. The participants will be randomly assigned into 3 groups, each of 12 people, namely, routine care group, routine care plus electrical-acupuncture experiment group, and routine care plus transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation group.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants will receive once a day, three consecutive days of interventions in each group, including identical routine care. On each visit, severity index (SI) subject to the extent of erythema, tension and pain over breast will be assessed. Questionnaires of Breastfeeding Self-Efficacy Scale (BSES-SF) and of Edinburgh postnatal depression scale (EPDS) will be performed. Heart-rate variability was evaluated and recorded via a real-time handheld HRV device. Oxycontin, Cortisol, sodium and potassium levels in breastmilk will be tested . A telephone follow-up will be performed in 30 days after completion of treatment, and the data will be collected and analyzed.

clinical_study.why_stopped: No grants from the Ministry of Science and Technology or school grants, no funds can be executed, so the application is terminated.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from Baselines of Severity Index, at each treatment and 1 month later
primary_outcome.description: Sum of the degree of Erythema, Tension and Pain scores over breasts

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from Baseline of EPDS, after each treatment and 1 month later
Changes from Baseline of BEES-SF, after each treatment and 1 month later

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline of HRV, immediately after each treatment
Changes from Baseline of Oxytocin and Cortisol levels, immediately after each treatment
other_outcome.description: Measurements of Oxytocin and Cortisol levels in breastmilk

arm_group.description: Routine care for early postpartum breast engorgement, including reverse pressure technique over areola, along with hand expression of breastmilk.
Routine care for early postpartum breast engorgement, including reverse pressure technique over areola, along with hand expression of breastmilk. plus: Electrical acupuncture on body acupoints

Routine care for early postpartum breast engorgement, including reverse pressure technique over areola, along with hand expression of breastmilk. plus: Transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation on breasts

intervention.description: Reverse pressure applied to the areola
Acupuncture on Hegu, Sanyinjiao, Zusanli and Taichong with electrical stimulation
Transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation over bil breasts

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Gestational age > 37 wk
- Delivery of singleton, healthy newborn baby
- Within 7 days postpartum
- Within 24 hours from initial painful breast engorgement
- Difficulty on lactation due to plugged ducts, SI index ≧ 5 (0-19)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Fever>37.5∘C
- Mastitis or breast abscess
- Signs of sepsis or other infection
- Perinatal mother and infant diseases (Gestational hypertension、Gestational Diabetes Mellitus、Pre-eclampsia 、Gestational thyroid diseases or Intrauterine growth retardation)
- Psychological diseases
- Bleeding tendency
- Artificial valves
- Pacemaker
- Epilepsy
- Consciousness disturbance
- Skin infections
- Hepatitis B carrier
- Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome
- Breast tumors
- Breast Surgeries

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Chinese Medicine, China Medical University
